content.question: In the case Twining v. New Jersey (1908), the Supreme Court held that the Fifth Amendmentâ€™s protection against self-incrimination is not applicable to the states. In 1964 the Supreme Court overruled the decision in Malloy v. Hogan (1964) and held that the right was incorporated to the states. This scenario illustrates which of the following?

choices.label: The Supreme Court oftentimes overrules lower court decisions.
Constitutional amendments can be used to overturn previous Supreme Court decisions.
The executive branch can sometimes evade Supreme Court decisions.
Ideological changes to the Supreme Court can lead to the overturning of precedent.

content.answer: Ideological changes to the Supreme Court can lead to the overturning of precedent.
